Issues.Title: Refactor CodeDomSerializerBase.Trace methods for string interpolation
Issues.Body:
Contributes to #8203

## Proposed changes

This one is more involved than the previous ones. Here, we remove all the format-string overloads of the (internal) `CodeDomSerializerBase.Trace*` methods to replace them with interpolated-string-accepting ones.

If you think the changes are too big, I can add the new overloads and port the code to them over multiple PRs

Issues.Title: Multiline Checkbox text is deleted on Save
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64-bit) - Preview
Version 17.6.0 Preview 1.0


### .NET version

N/A

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

Unknown

### Issue description

When multiline CheckBox is created, using Designer, when form is saved the text is deleted.


### Steps to reproduce

Create a form, add a CheckBox, Use dropdown under CheckBox.Text to enter multiple lines of text. Hit <Control><Enter> to Save the  text and you will see it on the design surface. Now Save the Form. The text is deleted from Form.Designer.
[CheckBoxText Disapears.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10877409/CheckBoxText.Disapears.zip)

### Diagnostics

```text
Silent. No errors.
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Multiline Checkbox text is deleted on Save" (#8735)

Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: Convert Stack usage to Stack<T> where possible
Issues.Body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

Winforms uses legacy `Stack` collection at places where it could be easily swapped with the more modern `Stack<T>` without affecting public API

### Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

Convert `Stack` usage to `Stack<T>` to remove needless casting.

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

Not that I'm aware of
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Convert Stack usage to Stack<T> where possible" (#8728)

Issues.Title: Replace Stack with Stack<T> across codebase
Issues.Body:
Fixes #8728


## Proposed changes

Convert `Stack` usage to `Stack<T>` in DesignerHost and UndoEngine

Issues.Title: Wrong text in ComboBox
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

6.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

ComboBox is added to the form and DropDownStyle is set to DropDownList.
Multiple items added to ComboBox and SelectedIndex set to 0.
In runtime you need to click on the button to open the items list and very quickly move the mouse pointer to any other value in the list then 0.
ComboBox displays wrong value in text box area.
Further, if you move the mouse pointer over the list items, then the value in text box area no longer changes.

Also this problem is reproduced in DrawMode = OwnerDrawFixed.

Video:
![ComboBoxIssue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/103027300/222373326-57a1e92d-c810-42bf-8f78-1496a9679cf6.gif)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create form, add ComboBox and set DropDownStyle to DropDownList, or use [sample app](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10869021/TestComboBox6.zip) (then go to 3).
2. Add 6 items to ComboBox and set SelectedIndex to 0.
3. Run app.
4. Click on the button to open the items list.
5. Very quickly move the mouse pointer to any other value in the list then 0.
6. Observe wrong value in text box area.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Wrong text in ComboBox" (#8731)

Issues.Title: RichTextBox could not be used in VS designer with AOT enabled
Issues.Body: ### Environment 17.5.0 ### .NET version 7.0.102 ### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release? _No response_ ### Issue description when drag a RichTextBox to a Form, VS Designer will show this error: Built-in COM has been disabled via a feature switch. See https://aka.ms/dotnet-illink/com for more ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1876179/222307893-d9791b14-d135-43a1-94d7-2161fe76c1ed.png) demo project: [TestWinFormsApp.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/10866768/TestWinFormsApp.zip) ### Steps to reproduce 1. edit csproj file , add: < PublishAot>true< /PublishAot> <_SuppressWinFormsTrimError>true< /_SuppressWinFormsTrimError> 2. drag a RichTextBox to a Form ### Diagnostics _No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "RichTextBox could not be used in VS designer with AOT enabled" (#8730)

Issues.Title: Add interpolated string handler to TraceSwitchExtensions.TraceVerbose
Issues.Body:
Contributes to #8203

## Proposed changes

As stated in #8715, TraceSwitchExtensions.TraceVerbose doesn't handle interpolated strings despite replacing code that does (`Debug.WriteLineIf`). This is a proposed fix. Note that unlike `Debug.WriteIfInterpolatedStringHandler`, which is an obvious inspiration to this PR, we don't pull (yet?) `StringBuilder` instances as the caching mechanism is internal to corelib.

Issues.Title: Use interpolated strings in System.ComponentModel.Design
Issues.Body:
Contributes to #8203

Changes encompass all files in src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/ComponentModel/Design

There are more string.Format usages in the [`CodeDomSerializerBase.Trace`](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/190f292dbcaca33edbc7a0d5ac48ddcf31cf4627/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/ComponentModel/Design/Serialization/CodeDomSerializerBase.cs#L491) method that I can remove in a follow-up PR using a custom interpolated string handler.

## Test methodology

Static code analysis, CI
